website_summaries.verdict: Despite a few concerns common to wooden spoons, this handmade utensil has a lot to offer when it comes to versatility, craftsmanship, and looks.
pros: Handcrafted of olive wood, which is both lightweight and fairly durable
13.75" size is practical for many cooking and serving purposes
Attractive – looks great displayed on a kitchen hutch or countertop
cons: Tends to dry out, but washing it by hand and keeping it oiled helps
Some owners report a strange odor/flavor that tends to fade with use

customer_reviews.title: 1 of 6 defective (or maybe it just is Very Hand-made - depends on your expectations)
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 6 total, 2 of each size. Small = 5 stars, if you want a small wooden spoon, not sure how it can be better. Medium = 1 star for poor quality control - one of two handle was very bowed or warped (picture). Seems to be due to grain of the wood being very curved, but at some point the maker should just toss it and say this piece of wood doesn't make a good spoon. Large = 4 stars, measures as indicated, but seems like at this size the spoon bowl should be larger. It's basically the smaller spoon with a longer handle, not a proportionally blown up version of the smaller spoons.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful spoon, but chipped quickly
customer_reviews.text: I really want to love this, as it is a beautiful spoon and feels so nice in my hands. I found that it does not dry out and splinter as easily as some other wooden utensils, namely a bamboo spatula I have. However, it chipped after only 5 months of occasional use. I was always gentle with the spoon and only hand washed it, so it's quite disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: The color faded after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: I love olive wood. I have a cheese board made from this wood and it's beautiful, it has been for a while now. So I got this spoon in hopes it would have the same bright olive wood look. Alas, that's not what happened. The spoon looked ok when I first got it but after I used it a few times it became grayish. I oiled it numerous times but it did not seem to help. While the spoon is holding up well and I like the shape of it, and the length of the handle, I am quite disappointed with the color fading.
customer_reviews.author: Runya

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this product a better review, but the spoon started splintering and the wood began to chip on the rounded area after a few uses. Based on this, I can only give one star. I ended up throwing the spoon away because I did not want pieces of wood in my food.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah LG

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after my very old wooden spoon began to splinter apart. This olivewood spoon was the most similar I could find, and I wanted to give it a good workout before reviewing it. So far it's great! Sturdy and we'll shaped, nicely proportioned for general cooking needs. As a little bonus, the two-tone grain of the wood is attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Selinko

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and functional
customer_reviews.text: Having had cheap wooden spoons that splinter and break, this is a pleasure to work with. It does not pick up food odors or stains. -- should NEVER put it in the dishwasher and hand wash it immediately after use. It looks classic and homey, and looks as nice as when it first arrived. Perhaps just more "seasoned" than when new.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy V

customer_reviews.title: More like the original “wooden spoons”
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for a wooden spoon with a long handle for years since the one I grew up with broke. They all seen too thick and with short handles. This came up as an add-on item and I grabbed it. I’m happy I did. The head is slightly small and the handle slightly thin, but it seems well made and the proportion is just much better than what I find in the stores.
customer_reviews.author: Winterbaby

customer_reviews.title: Item in  poor condition
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality item. Do not recommend. Opened item and spoon was dirty and chipped in two places. 1 star. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! This is THE SPOON!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this spoon to round out my collection of wooden spoons and boy, has it ever! First, it is a beautiful bit of Olive wood craftsmanship, smooth, sturdy and ergonomically sound. Second, this spoon is the ideal size, fit and finish to store and sample a nice, steaming pot of tomato sauce while cooking Mother’s Sunday recipe. Last, this spoon has an uncanny way of motivating the unruly! But this spoon now! This is your next big win!!
customer_reviews.author: TNI

customer_reviews.title: So far so good but not totally what expected
customer_reviews.text: I have only had it for a few weeks (hence the lower durability rating) and i like the spoon's grain. It was thirsty so I have oiled it twice and used it twice. I chose this one because the info said carved from one piece of wood....this may be true but it's 2 pieces. A bit deceptive.
customer_reviews.author: J M.

customer_reviews.title: terrible taste
customer_reviews.text: This spoon tastes bad. If you use it to scoop food, the food tastes bad. If you lick the spoon, the spoon tastes bad. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy E Ousterhout

customer_reviews.title: very clunky
customer_reviews.text: You would have to be making a huge vat of food to be able to use this spoon successfully. Not for the general home cook, unless you make large batches. A pity.
customer_reviews.author: latraviata

customer_reviews.title: Broken before 1st use
customer_reviews.text: My husband was hand-washing this right after we opened the package and the head snapped off.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Product NOT as Pictured
customer_reviews.text: The spoon I received is NOT olive wood. I own previous olive wood utensils and this spoon is definitely just made out of pure regular bench wood. Spoon is also not finished well - there are some thought patches. The spoon is not as pictured nor does it have the beautiful swirls that olive wood is aesthetic for (and as pictured). Would not recommend - do NOT purchase. Not worth your money or effort.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Lin

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: A bit expensive, but I have it a while now and it cleans up well and has not cracked or warped or stained. I'll never buy a wooden spoon in a grocery store again as they split, stain and break easily. it came quickly and is well made. It looks as if it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: LuLu

customer_reviews.title: Almost too pretty to use
customer_reviews.text: This spoon is gorgeous. It feels very sturdy, the handle is nice and long, and the surfaces are so smooth. We are trying to move away from plastic and silicone cooking utensils and would absolutely consider getting more of these while making that switch.
customer_reviews.author: Northwest Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These Olivewood spoons (I bought two of them) are gorgeous, sturdy and the wood is fine-grained and smooth. Overall construction is really very good. I can see these lasting for years with proper care...much better than the pinewood wooden spoons you get at the department store, and the bowl of the spoons aren't just a minor indentation like some wooden spoons have, but hold a decent amount of substance.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Massimini

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully crafted olive wood
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted an olive wood cooking utensil for a long time. When my current wooden spoon developed a huge crack in it, I took the opportunity to get myself one. This spoon is beautifully crafted, and long enough to use in a deep stock pot. Be sure to season it to ensure a long life. I used coconut oil to season mine, so I expect it to outlast me.
customer_reviews.author: Peter57

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use this spoon whenever I make soups and stews. So much more enjoyable than a synthetic plastic/silicone one. After washing it, I recommend using a few drops of wood-conditioning oil on it to keep it moisturized in between uses.
customer_reviews.author: NorthEast81

customer_reviews.title: What I'm looking for
customer_reviews.text: I cook a lot, make a lot of stews and sauces and needed a tasting spoon that was long enough to dip into large pots, yet still small enough that I could take a taste without having to wrap my mouth around a large spoon. Your standard tasting spoon on Amazon is roughly the size of your baskin robbins tasting spoon, in all sorts of fancy materials, colors and prices. I'm not making ice cream, i'm simmering at varying temperatures for a long time, and I don't want a steam burn dipping my hand all the way to the bottom. This spoon did the job, although the lip is still a bit too thick for my convenience.
customer_reviews.author: H C

customer_reviews.title: A much higher quality wood spoon than most on the market today
customer_reviews.text: This olive wood spoon seems stronger by far than the other wood spoons l have which eventually break, even after a few uses. This seems sturdier and much more appealing. I will oil it with natural mineral oil so food will release more readily and it will wash clean with little effort and no soaking. At this point, after several uses, I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Cajun GourmetTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Nice Spoon
customer_reviews.text: Very nice spoon. It seems to be well made. Easy to clean. The manufacturer recommends using olive oil on it regularly as a maintenance .
customer_reviews.author: Nicole M

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Spoon!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: 2014: I've had this spoon for five years and it is still like new. I oil it occasionally for maintenance and hand wash only. It's my favorite utensil to use. 2009: I have had this spoon for 5 months now and it is still like new. The wood is beautiful. The spoon is light weight, though very sturdy. The wood remains unstained no matter what I use it on! I bought a Calphalon (ASIN: B000Q4XDNG) at the same time for a fraction of the cost and it has already split. Spend the extra money and get a wonderful product that lasts and lasts. I will definitely buy HIC products again.
customer_reviews.author: K. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size
customer_reviews.text: The spoon is not deep. It is not large. It is high quality. Robust. The handle is long in ratio to the spoon area so it has excellent moving characteristics for stirring stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I refuse to believe it was made in Europe as they claim in description. It does not have any marking of where it was manufactured and it is the poorest quality wooden spoon i have ever seen!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it's OK
customer_reviews.text: The spoon is not as thin as I'd like it to be, nor is the shape perfect for some reason I find hard to describe, but the length is right for me for cooking. The wood is not as pretty as some olive wood utensils I have or I've seen in other places. So I do not reach for it instinctively, as I do for my olive wood spatula. It has made me realize that I want to see a wooden utensil I'll buy rather than buy sight unseen online.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela L. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Spoon
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to our kitchen utensils! It’s very sturdy and smooth texture!
customer_reviews.author: SarahMc

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This spoon has two large cracks in it after very little use.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Excellent spoon!
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a quality wooden spoon. It's sturdy and nice looking and feels great in the hand with a good handle. I bake a lot and have had wrist problems so I'm particular about my wooden spoons. This is a keeper and I will buy another!
customer_reviews.author: Fan of the Outdoors 🏞️

customer_reviews.title: Black mold all over
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived in two days. But when I opened the plastic bag, the smell of the spoon was something wrong. Then I noticed that the black mold is on the spoon. I wonder the company does not conduct the quality check.
customer_reviews.author: Kon

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite spoons.
customer_reviews.text: We have three this size and one of the 14 inch. We recommend these spoons.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Coburn

customer_reviews.title: Smart . . . and beautiful.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful. Hate to risk using it. I'll probably just oil it up with walnut oil and keep it in plain view. But olive wood is known to be durable, and this is very nicely crafted. Great gift item.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence from Hackensack

customer_reviews.title: no use
customer_reviews.text: this spoon, even I can't scoop the soup!!!! it's so shallow and thick wood.......no use and can't send it back!!!!!!!! only good for stir........
customer_reviews.author: needtoshop

customer_reviews.title: I get tired of buying wooden spoons that have a ...
customer_reviews.text: I get tired of buying wooden spoons that have a rough surface. This spoon is smooth. I immediately had to wash it up and use it. I keep picking it up when I am cooking. I think I have had it for 3 days and it has stirred about 6 meals now.
customer_reviews.author: bg1

customer_reviews.title: beautiful to look at and so enjoyable to use
customer_reviews.text: These olive wood utensils are so very special, beautiful to look at and so enjoyable to use. Bought a couple of them for my husband for Christmas and he is so proud to have them in his kitchen collection. Fast delivery, wonderful quality.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Damaged handle on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these wooden spoons. Unfortunately one came with two huge gashes in base of the handle where you’d hold the spoon - not comfortable and could splinter. Returning the damaged one. The undamaged one seems nice enough, but for the price I’m disappointed that quality control isn’t better.
customer_reviews.author: John Hare

customer_reviews.title: Great spoon.
customer_reviews.text: We bought a second one because one was always in the dishwasher. Great spoon for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Coburn

customer_reviews.title: solid feel of this spoon is just what I like. It's a good thing my mom didn't have ...
customer_reviews.text: In our house this is used for cookie dough, pancake batters, folding egg whites into cakes, etc. The stiff, solid feel of this spoon is just what I like. It's a good thing my mom didn't have spoons this strong when I was a kid or I would probably have had a bruised coccyx (but overall better behavior).
customer_reviews.author: Drew IC

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Swapping out my old and bringing in the new this year. Wash and dry, no dishwasher. And this worth every penny. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Loux Dba Vintage

customer_reviews.title: Nice & sturdy wooden spoon
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. This is also a good length for larger pots. I've had the beechwood spoons before and the wood started to get fuzzy after use and cleaning. Some even had a split down the middle of the spoon. This one does not seem to do that yet and hopefully will last a long time. It's also a really nice warm wood color. I like to have my utensils looking good and lasting a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Online shopper

customer_reviews.title: this spoon is so well-made, your grandchildren will inherit
customer_reviews.text: These spoons are very well-made, and much nicer than the "bamboo" products that are popular right now. My spoon has had about 6 months of heavy use now and is still in excellent condition. It holds up great in the dishwasher. The wood grain is smooth and beautiful, and the handle is very sturdy. I have received several compliments from guests about my wooden cookware (an odd thing to compliment in my opinion!). The wood has not dried out like cheaper wooden spoons I have owned. I recommend this product to anyone who spends a lot of time in the kitchen and is looking for good quality wooden cookware.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Spoon
customer_reviews.text: I love this spoon - it's solid, and has the feel of the wooden spoons my mother had. It doesn't feel like it will crack under pressure like the cheap pine utensils I have purchased in the past. Make sure you oil it with mineral oil or some kind of kitchen-grade oil for cutting boards before use to keep it in good condition (don't use salad oil!). I would definitely recommend this spoon.
customer_reviews.author: Em Zebra

customer_reviews.title: I hate wooden spoons so I've been resisting purchasing one
customer_reviews.text: I hate wooden spoons so I've been resisting purchasing one. But sometimes you really just need a wooden spoon for cooking, right? This one is great. Well crafted and the wood is soft and smooth. Will need conditioning, I'm sure, to keep it that way.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: great item!
customer_reviews.text: Mother in law approved! I had been looking for one that would pass her high standards and reliably sourced wood for 2 years. She loved it and I plan to buy one for myself. I had purchased a cheaper one from another company at one point but never used it since it smelled heavily of chemicals, and I could never find out if it was manufactured with unsafe chemicals.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Park

customer_reviews.title: Nice spoon
customer_reviews.text: Nice spoon but I hoped the finish would have been a little more sealed and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: ahigh

customer_reviews.title: Strong and nicely made
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a surprise, this spoon is sturdy, looks and works great! Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Tania Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs a wooden spoon!
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure I'm not using or caring for it like I should. It's faded now but that's my fault for not oiling it, but it still functions like the day I purchased it! Great for stirring sauces and what not. Won't scratch your pots or pans. It's a shallow wood spoon that I love and my wife does too :)
customer_reviews.author: Average Pete

customer_reviews.title: Love this spoon and use it for all of my ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this spoon and use it for all of my cooking now, especially sauces. I love all olive wood products and there really should be more!
customer_reviews.author: Jess Hsiao

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: The best wooden spoon, I use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, wish it were bigger
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely made spoon. All one piece, good olive wood, surface is smooth and accepts mineral oil nicely. This would be perfect if the spoon was an inch wider and longer, and the handle was 2 inches longer. This mfg does offer a one with a longer handle, but the spoon is the same size.
customer_reviews.author: Wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, classy utensil for the kitchen, I like this better than plastic or rubber utensils.
customer_reviews.author: noky64

customer_reviews.title: Quality spoon
customer_reviews.text: Nice, solid, well made spoon. Definitely worth the purchase. Seems like it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great spoons that age well
customer_reviews.text: These are great. We have a couple that we use constantly. They age well and develop a "patina" over time. Unlike other wood spoons, these don't crack and splinter and they seem to be made of a harder, denser wood.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love it... not too big which is exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: KFolk

customer_reviews.title: Nice Spoon
customer_reviews.text: Nice wooden spoon, with some olive wood grain. But not a lot. I've seen other Olive Wood spoons with much more stronger grain pattern. But, the spoon is nice to hold and works well, is a good length for cooking in a big pot.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Attractive and good quality wooden spoon. Will be buying more from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Lassie

customer_reviews.title: Best wooden spoon I own
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite spoon. I use it for everything and it is so beautiful too
customer_reviews.author: MrsOakes71

customer_reviews.title: The only ones worth having
customer_reviews.text: Wonderfully smooth and comfortable in the hand, these are such an improvement over traditional wood spoons (ash, maple?) which tend to warp and stain. Many are not even properly finished, so that they're very rough. Not these, however. A joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: BigD

customer_reviews.title: pretty and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Wooden spoons are either cheap (both in quality and price). This is a good value. I don't wash them in the dishwasher and I don't let them soak. I oil them occasionally with olive oil or cooking oil and they are still pretty after a few months of near-daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Kate M.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Loved it. Item as expected and when you rub in the oil it gives it a great look
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Happy stirring!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why, but I am obssessed with these spoons. Durable, perfect size and length. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed in this spoon
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed in this spoon. It has a nice size and weight to it but after one use and a quick rinse in the sink it was very dry. I have oiled it using a butcher block mineral oil and hope that helps.
customer_reviews.author: M. Owen

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: For several years I've been using some old wooden spoons that a friend was discarding. She told me that there were better spoons out there. I figure it's time to have some good ones. This is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Main

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful grain
customer_reviews.text: Gorgeous grain on this olive wood. I've been using for a couple of months and still looks brand new. Just be careful not to leave sitting in water. I hand wash mine and occasionally rub food grade mineral oil into the wood to keep the grain looking beautful.
customer_reviews.author: RobinDTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Nice spoon, good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Have had this spoon for months now and use it regularly. As other reviewers have said, don't put it in the dishwasher, wash it by hand. Every so soften, I will apply a light coat of olive oil to it as it tends to look pale and dry. No cracking, nice handle length and a good head design. Good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: MagicMike239

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful! Feels sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful! Feels sturdy, like it will last forever. Good size and feels good to use. I immediately ordered another one. Looks so nice in my spoon vase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Wooden Spoon
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality wooden spoon. The spoon part is round, and it's held up quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Dm

customer_reviews.title: Cracked after a year
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these spoons. One got heavier use (about 4x/week), the other lighter use (about 2x/month). Both were always hand washed. After a year, both developed large cracks in the middle of the spoon bowl - large enough to trap liquid food (sauce, soup). Before that, both were fine spoons - the bowl was a decent shape, comfortable to use, and durable enough for the relatively lightweight tasks I used them for (no mixing large bowls of heavy dough).
customer_reviews.author: P. A. Vinger

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived I was very impressed with the quality of the wood. Not only did it look nice but it appeared to be very solid. I have some cheaper spoons that have warped badly. It is a nice weight and washes up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: jacksmom

customer_reviews.title: Great wooden spoon
customer_reviews.text: Great wooden spoon. I’m very happy with my purchase so far. After using it for a couple months I plan on purchasing others from the same brand.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi J Brancheau

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I love these olive wood products. I purchased this one and several of the other spoons. They hold up well and have not cracked or dried out after over a year of use. I sometimes toss in the dishwasher, but mostly handwash to preserve the wood longer.
customer_reviews.author: tsuki

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Spoons
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered one to try it out several years ago. Now eight spoons later, I'll never buy anything but olive wood spoons. They are denser than those you buy in the mass market. Mine have never cracked and seem easier to clean than other kinds of wooden spoons. This company is great! Their quality couldn't be better.
customer_reviews.author: Texas girl

customer_reviews.title: Wow, beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy spoon, it feels like it is of good quality. The wood is gorgeous. I almost don't want to use it because it is so beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Dodd

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this spoon!
customer_reviews.text: This product is wonderful. I absolutely LOVE this spoon. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Paul J McGeough

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful spoon
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful quality and very beautiful. Remember to occasionally oil the spoon with mineral oil to keep it vibrant.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great spoon!
customer_reviews.text: Works for a variety of uses, really everything I could want from a wooden spoon.
customer_reviews.author: Shain

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, awesome and well made. Quite a bit bigger than I'd expectedbut that's my fault. Not any harm ,I was just .surprised
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is my best friend. Anyone who's into cooking should have it. Sturdy wood with nice weight.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful spoon
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful spoon. Should last forever. I did treat with oil before use and will again occasionally. Helps keep wood from absorbing other liquids and keep it beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon buyer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy yet art
customer_reviews.text: The craftsmanship on this spoon is gorgeous! Sturdy yet art.
customer_reviews.author: Therese D. Scoles

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Spoon!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this spoon for my mother for Christmas this year, and she loves it! The wood is smooth (almost soft), beautiful and aromatic. I paid a good amount of money for this spoon and am very impressed with the quality. It is one piece and probably will never break or snap. I would recommend this spoon for any cook.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Love this spoon!
customer_reviews.text: Love this spoon! I have ones that are more expensive and this one is just as good!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful cooking spoon! Olive wood is great and long-lasting. I love that it's sourced in a sustainable way.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, and the finish is so much better than just the ordinary wooden spoons that splinter.
customer_reviews.author: Agapanthus

customer_reviews.title: Not a solid piece
customer_reviews.text: The handle is doweled to the spoon. It is not a solid piece.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it well made
customer_reviews.text: very well made, my new spoon to use for my Sunday Gravy :)
customer_reviews.author: KMM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Wooden Spoon
customer_reviews.text: My fiance loves it! She says its the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This olive wood spoon looks good and does its job well. Made a perfect Christmas present supplement for a person who loves to cook.
customer_reviews.author: Compassonate Believer

customer_reviews.title: just not as nice as cherry wood that we replaced it with
customer_reviews.text: Ok, won't knock your socks off. Does the job,just not as nice as cherry wood that we replaced it with!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Very nicely made!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nicely made wooden spoon. I've been enjoying using it in the kitchen. High quality at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Great wood spoon
customer_reviews.text: Whats not too like? There was a slight, very slight residual olive smell for a few uses but that quickly went away. I use this every day and love it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Perovich

customer_reviews.title: Great spoon, I keep it oiled and marvel at ...
customer_reviews.text: Great spoon, I keep it oiled and marvel at how beautiful the wood is every time. It has become a staple in the kitchen and one a gift to my mother.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Wilbur

customer_reviews.title: beautiful spoon
customer_reviews.text: THis is a great spoon and I couldn't believe the price. I almost bought one at Williams Sonoma for about 4 times the price and this seems to be almost the exact spoon. The weight is very nice, the color is beautiful. I have treated it with food safe oil a couple times, but I don't know that I even needed to do that. UPDATE: I noticed the price has significantly increased so although it's still a great spoon, please compare prices!
customer_reviews.author: B. Seeman

product_meta.title: Eddington’s Italian Olive Wood Cooking Spoon Handcrafted in Europe, 13.75-Inches
product_meta.description: Size:13.75-InchesEddington’s Olive Wood Spoon makes cooking beautiful and easy. For all of your food preparation, cooking, baking and serving, this is a perfect kitchen utensil for whipping up everything from a snack to an evening meal and holiday feast. Lightweight, yet strong, and safe for everyone to use, even families with budding young chefs just learning to cook. Although it fits nicely in a kitchen gadget drawer, this attractive cooking tool displays beautifully on the counter, always at the ready. Favoured for its beautiful grain and dense durable character, Mediterranean olive wood has been used for centuries to craft fine tableware and utensils. Carefully sourced from selected groves mainly in the south of Italy, the wood is only harvested when olive production has ceased or branches have been cut as part of the pruning process. Over time, with oiling and use, olive wood will darken in colour and develop a rich patina, further enhancing the appearance and grain. It will not scratch surfaces and is safe for metal and nonstick cookware. Hand wash only.
feature_bullets: Eddington’s Olive Wood Cooking Spoon for stirring, mixing, dividing, tasting, turning, and serving foods
Made in Europe from fine Italian Olivewood; lightweight yet strong; measures 13.75-inches
Beautifully handcrafted, decorative, and durable; fits neatly in a kitchen gadget drawer or display on the counter in a utensil holder
This olive wood is carefully sourced from selected groves mainly in the south of Italy; harvested when olive production ceases or from pruned branches
Will not scratch surfaces; safe for use on nonstick cookware; hand wash only; occasionally coat with mineral oil to keep olive wood looking its best
